data.headline: Elderly Evictions
data.summary: The Tampa Tribune uncovered that a large nursing-home chain planned to evict more than 50 poor residents in Tampa. This initiated a broader investigation revealing systemic issues with elderly care in Florida's nursing homes operated by big corporations.

data.headline: Unsafe Taps
data.summary: USA Today's investigation highlighted major violations of safe drinking water laws across the U.S. Thousands of public water systems fail to meet health standards, with minimal enforcement actions taken.

data.headline: Upcoding Downfall
data.summary: An investigation revealed that small for-profit hospitals in Ohio were claiming higher Medicare reimbursements by overstating patient illnesses on paper, illustrating a fraudulent practice known as upcoding.

data.headline: Treatment Disparity
data.summary: A Newsday investigation into racial disparities in health care in New York found that black patients received less aggressive treatment than white patients, contributing to differential health outcomes.

data.headline: Wanted: Mentally Ill
data.summary: The Chicago Tribune revealed that Illinois was placing mentally ill patients in nursing homes, leading to abuse and neglect, due to financial incentives from Medicaid.

data.headline: Revisiting Hours
data.author_title: The Indianapolis Star and The Indianapolis News
data.summary: A follow-up investigation by The Indianapolis Star uncovered an increase in health violations and racial disparities in care quality in nursing homes, prompting legislative scrutiny.
